title: Add “Site Soundtrack” label above YouTube Music links

requirements.text: In the frontend section that currently displays the YouTube Music access hyperlinks, add a single-line label directly above those hyperlinks with the exact text: "Site Soundtrack." Style the label with a medium-sized font and a rich, brilliant neon lime green font color.

quotes: First thing to do on today, right above the youtube music access hyperlinks, I want to add the word "Site Soundtrack." Middle-sized fonts to be used. Also, the Font color should be a rich and brilliante Neon Lime Green!

acceptanceCriteria: The text "Site Soundtrack" appears immediately above the existing YouTube Music access hyperlinks (no other content inserted between them).
The label uses a medium-sized font (e.g., Tailwind `text-lg` or `text-xl`) and is visually distinct from surrounding text.
The label text color is neon lime green (e.g., Tailwind `text-[#39FF14]` or an equivalent neon-lime value) and renders correctly in the app theme(s).
No other copy is changed and the YouTube Music hyperlinks continue to function as before.

constraints: Frontend files under frontend.immutablePaths must not be modified (compose existing hooks/components instead).
Do not change any backend canister code for this UI-only request.
nonGoals: Do not add, remove, or change the YouTube Music hyperlink URLs.
Do not redesign the surrounding section beyond inserting and styling this single label.
